main event: On September 13, 1953, in Atherton, California, an object similar to a balloon or blimp was observed traveling in a westerly direction at an estimated altitude of 30,000 ft.
interesting points: The object appeared to be static and was obscured intermittently from view.
The observation was reported by a credible witness, Leonard Sherman, from Atherton, California.
The U.S. Air Force requested gathering supporting data to identify the object in accordance with Air Force Regulation 200-2.
Investigation revealed balloons in the area at the time of the sighting, leading to the conclusion that the observed object was likely one of these balloons.
Additionally, a separate report mentions a sighting of the Aurora Borealis in the North Atlantic on September 19, 1953.
sighted object: object similar to a balloon or blimp
